isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Front Cover, Cooling System, and Related Components - Installation - Vibration Damper, Hub, and Wear Sleeve

svcproc.title: Vibration Damper, Hub, and Wear Sleeve

figure.caption: POSE seal (MaxxForce™ 9 and 10 only) and wear sleeve orientation

note.para: If service kit contains more than one wear sleeve, use sleeve that has the same width as the current wear sleeve.
MaxxForce™ 9 and 10 engines have a POSE dust seal attached to the wear sleeve. A dust seal is not used on MaxxForce™ DT engines.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, for MaxxForce™ 9 and 10 engines, replace the POSE dust seal and front oil seal as a set. For MaxxForce™ DT engines, only use a front oil seal designed without a matching dust seal.

note.para: The chamfer (rounded edge) of the wear sleeve outside diameter must face in, toward the engine.

step1.para:
Apply Loctite® 569 Hydraulic Sealant
to the inside diameter of a new wear sleeve.

figure.caption: Front seal and wear sleeve installation

calloutgroup.callout1: Front Seal and Wear Sleeve Installer
POSE dust seal (MaxxForce™ 9 and 10 engines only )

step1.para:
Center the damper hub, new wear sleeve, and Front Seal and Wear Sleeve Installer
under press ram.
Carefully press the new wear sleeve on the damper hub until sleeve is fully seated.
Wipe any excess sealant off the outside diameter of the wear sleeve.
Mark damper hub with 100 °C (212 °F) Thermo-melt crayon .

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not heat damper hub assembly above 100 °C (212 °F).

step1.para: Heat damper hub on a hot plate or other controlled heat source until Thermo-melt crayon mark melts.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear heat insulated gloves when handling heated components.

step1.para: Install damper hub on crankshaft while wearing heat insulated gloves. Make sure keyway groove on damper hub aligns with keyway in crankshaft.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, damper hub must be completely seated on the crankshaft.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, only use 15.2 mm (0.60) in thick damper retainer and Class 12.9 damper bolts.

step1.para: Install damper retainer and three M12 x 40 damper bolts. Verify damper retainer is 15.2 mm (0.60) in thick and damper bolts are Class 12.9.
Tighten three M12 x 40 damper bolts to special torque .

Retighten three M12 x 40 damper bolts in sequence to special torque
several times until each bolt has no movement.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, verify damper hub dowel pin is aligned with dowel hole of the vibration damper assembly.

step1.para: Install vibration damper assembly on damper hub and align dowel hole in damper with dowel pin on damper hub.
Install six M10 x 16 bolts finger tight.
Tighten six M10 x 16 bolts to special torque .
